name: ExpenseReceipt_GetAll
description: Get a range of Expense Receipts, a filter needs to be specified. ScreenId=EP301020

inventory.description: Identifies the inventory item from the document

project.description: Identifies the project from the document

claimedBy.description: Identifies the employee from the document

customer.description: Identifies the customer from the document

erp-api-background.description: If a URL value is provided, then API endpoint will be queued and executed in background. When the execution of the background operation is finished, the system will POST the response to the specified URL. The endpoint itself responds in this case with a 202-Accepted status and a reference to a state document for the background operation.

$block: This class represents a Expense Receipt in ExpenseReceiptController. Used by getting data.

$ul: **branch**: Mandatory field: The top part > Branch > The company branch that will incur the expenses.
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**: Click the magnifier. > The identifier.
**claimAmount**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Expense claim > The expense claim with which the expense receipt is associated.
**claimedBy**: Mandatory field: The top part > Claimed by* > 	The name of the employee who is claiming the expenses.
**address**: General information tab > Address info section >
**addressId**
**addressLine1**: Address 1 > The first line of the customer's/supplier's/company's/employee's contact address.
**addressLine2**: Address 2 > The second line of the address.
**addressLine3**: Address 3 > The third line of the address.
**city**: City > The city.
**country**: Country > The country.
**errorInfo**
**id**: Mandatory field: Country ID* > The unique two-letter country ID according to international standard ISO 3166.
**metadata**
**maxPageSize**
**totalCount**
**name**: Mandatory field: Country name* > The complete name of the country.
**county**: County > The county or province.
**id**: Click the magnifier > The identifier
**name**: Click the magnifier > The displayed name
**postalCode**: Postcode > The postcode.
**branch**
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**: Click the magnifier. > The identifier.
**calendarID**
**contact**: General information tab > Contact section >

**attention**: Attention > The attention line as it is used in your customer's/supplier's/company's business letters. The intention of this line is to direct the letter to the right person if the letter is not addressed to any specific person.
**contactId**
**email**: Email > The email address of the customer/supplier/company as a business entity.
**employeeContact**: Employee contact > The link to the contact record associated with the employee.
**fax**: Fax > The fax number.
**firstName**: First name > The first name of the employee.
**lastName**: Mandatory field: Last name* > The last name of the employee.
**midName**: Middle name > The middle name of the employee.
**name**: Name > The legal name of to appear on the documents.
**phone1**: Phone 1 > The default phone number.
**phone2**: Phone 2 > An additional phone number.
**phone3**: Phone 3 > An additional phone number of the employee.
**title**: Title > The courtesy title to be used for the employee.
**web**: Web > The website of the company, if one exists.
**department**: Mandatory field: General information tab > Employee section > Department* > The department the employee works for.
**employeeClass**: Additional information about Employee User
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**employeeId**: Mandatory field: The top part > Employee ID* > The unique identifier, which is assigned to the employee in accordance with the configuration of the EMPLOYEE segmented key.
**employeeLogin**
**employeeName**: The top part > Employee name > The name of this employee.
**employeeNumber**: General information tab > Employee settings section > Employee ref. no. > A reference number for the employee.
**employeeUserId**: Employee internal user ID. This is the ID of the user linked to the employee
**errorInfo**
**lastModifiedDateTime**
**metadata**
**maxPageSize**
**totalCount**
**status**: Mandatory field: The top part > Status > The status of the employee. The following options are available: Active, On hold, Hold payments, Inactive, One-time.
**workGroupDescription**
**currency**: Both tabs > Currency > The currency of the expense receipt.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**customer**: Receipt details tab > Financial details section > Customer > The customer, which should be specified if the employee incurred the expenses while working for a particular customer.
**name**: Click the magnifier. > The name.
**number**
**date**: Both tabs > Date > The date of the expense receipt.
**description**: Open the receipt
**employeePart**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Employee part  > The part of the total amount that will not be paid back to the employee.
**expenseAccount**: Receipt details tab > Financial details section > Expense account > The expense account to which the system records the part of the expense to be paid back to the employee.
**description**: Name of item/description
**number**: Number of item
**type**
**expenseClaim**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Expense claim > The expense claim with which the expense receipt is associated.
**description**: Name of item/description
**number**: Number of item
**expenseSub**: Receipt details tab > Financial details section > Expense sub. > The corresponding subaccount the system uses to record the part of the expense to be paid back to the employee.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**image**: Receipt details tab > Image section
**id**: The ID of the attachment
**name**: The name of the attachment.
**revision**: The version of the attachment.
**internalId**
**inventory**
**description**: Name of item/description
**number**: Number of item
**invoiceable**: Receipt details tab > Financial details section > Invoiceable > A check box that indicates (if selected) that the customer should be invoiced for the claim amount.
**location**: Receipt details tab > Financial details section > Location > The location of the customer related to the expenses.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.

**project**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Project/contract > The project or contract, which should be specified if the employee incurred the expenses while working on a particular project or contract.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**projectTask**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Project task > The project task to which the expenses are related.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.
**quantity**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Quantity > The quantity of the expense item that the employee purchased according to the receipt.
**receiptId**: The top part > Employee > 	The identifier of the employee whose expense receipts you want to manage.
**refNbr**: Both tabs > Ref. no. > The reference number, which usually matches the number of the original receipt.
**salesAccount**: Receipt details tab > Financial details section > Sales account > The sales account to which the system records the part of the amount to charge the customer for.
**description**: Name of item/description
**number**: Number of item
**type**
**salesSub**: Receipt details tab > Financial details section > Sales sub. > The corresponding subaccount the system uses to record the amount to charge the customer for.
**description**: Click on the magnifier. > The description.
**id**: Click on the magnifier. > The identifier.

**status**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Expense claim status > The current status of the associated expense claim, which can be one of the following options: On hold, Pending apporval, Approved, Rejected, Released.
**taxCategory**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > VAT category > The tax category for the expense receipt.
**description**: Name of item/description
**number**: Number of item
**taxTotal**: The top part > VAT total > The total amount of VAT or taxes calculated for the expense receipt.
**totalAmount**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Amount > The total amount of the receipt (for VAT-inclusive taxes), or the total amount before taxes (for VAT-exclusive taxes).
**unitCost**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > Unit cost > The cost of one unit of the expense item.
**uom**: Receipt details tab > Expense details section > UoM > The unit of measure of the expense item.
**stateLocation**
